member.name: T:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ButtonPressEffectAdapter
member.summary: Macro board adapter that implements a software button press effect.
member.remarks: This vaguely mimics the perspective of a real button being pushed and provides better feedback to the user that a button push was registered.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ButtonPressEffectAdapter.#ctor(OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IMacroBoard)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The this effect should be applied to.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ButtonPressEffectAdapter.#ctor(OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IMacroBoard,OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ButtonPressEffectConfig)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The board that is wrapped with the button press effect.
The configuration that should be used. If null the default configuration will be used.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ButtonPressEffectAdapter.Config
member.summary: The configuration that controls the behavior of the button press effect feature.

member.name: T:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ButtonPressEffectConfig
member.summary: Configuration for

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ButtonPressEffectConfig.Scale
member.summary: Gets or sets a factor that determines how much the images gets smaller or even bigger when pressed.
member.remarks: It's basically a scale factor, if you want the image to be half the size use 0.5. One means no change and values larger than one make the image bigger when pressed.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ButtonPressEffectConfig.OriginX
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative x coordinate of the origin.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ButtonPressEffectConfig.OriginY
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative y coordinate of the origin.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ButtonPressEffectConfig.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color that is used when the button is shrunk.

member.name: T:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ConditionalDisposable`1
member.summary: A conditional disposable wrapper.
member.remarks: This class is used in situations where the wrapped element is either borrowed (in which case it shouldn't be disposed) or owned (in which case it should be disposed) and abstracts that away from the consumer. The consumer has to make sure to call dispose once they are finished and this wrapped decides whether the wrapped element is in fact disposed or not.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ConditionalDisposable`1.#ctor(`0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The wrapped item.
A flag that determines if the item will be disposed.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ConditionalDisposable`1.Item
member.summary: Gets the underlying wrapped item.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ConditionalDisposable`1.DisposeItem
member.summary: Get a value that determines whether the item will be disposed or not.

member.name: T:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ConnectionEventArgs
member.summary: Is used for events that communicate connection changes.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ConnectionEventArgs.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ConnectionEventArgs.NewConnectionState
member.summary: The new connection state.

member.name: T:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.DeviceConnectionChangedEventArgs
member.summary: An event argument that reports a connection status change for a particular device.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.DeviceConnectionChangedEventArgs.#ctor(OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IDeviceReference,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A device reference.
The current connection state.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.DeviceConnectionChangedEventArgs.DeviceReference
member.summary: Gets a handle to the device that changed.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.DeviceConnectionChangedEventArgs.Connected
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the connection state change. True if the device got connected, false if the device got disconnected.

member.summary: A device listener base to simplify device listener implementations.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.DeviceListenerBase.KnownDevices
member.summary: Gets a list of the currently known (at least seen once) devices.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.DeviceListenerBase.Subscribe(System.IObserver{OpenMacroBoard.SDK.DeviceStateReport})
member.summary: Subscribes an observer that will be notified when a device state changes.
member.returns: Returns a disposable subscription.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.DeviceListenerBase.Update(OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IDeviceReference,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates a device state. If the state has changed compared to the previous state all subscribed observers will be notified.
member.param: A referenced device which has changed.
The current connection state of the device.

member.name: F:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.DeviceListenerBase.Subscription.subscriberState
member.summary: Contains the state the subscriber knows about. This is used to calculate new updates.

member.summary: Gets the connection state.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.DeviceStateReport.NewDevice
member.summary: Gets the info if this device is new or not.

member.summary: Draw a given image as fullscreen (spanning over all keys)

member.name: T:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IDeviceContext
member.summary: Represents a context that tracks devices and their connection state using device listeners.
member.remarks: This is basically the entry point to opening a . Once constructed you can add device listeners for various providers and the context will collect all devices (even from different providers) in one place.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IDeviceContext.DeviceStateReports
member.summary: Gets the observable that reports all device state changes, for example like new devices or connection state changes.
member.remarks: Once subscribed, reports are generated to reflect the current state of known devices and their connection state. This does not mean that all original reports are replayed, but only the most recent events, that are needed to rebuild the currently known state for all known devices.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IDeviceContext.KnownDevices
member.summary: A list of known devices.
member.remarks: The order of the list is consistent and new devices are always added at the end.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IDeviceContext.AddListener(System.IObservable{OpenMacroBoard.SDK.DeviceStateReport})
member.summary: Registers a new device listener for that context.
member.remarks: Registered listeners can't be unsubscribed individually. All listeners will unsubscribed when the context is disposed.
member.returns: Returns the original instance to allow for fluent API calls.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IDeviceContext.AddListener(System.IObservable{OpenMacroBoard.SDK.DeviceStateReport},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers a new device listener for that context.

remarks.para: Registered listeners can't be unsubscribed individually. All listeners will unsubscribed when the context is disposed.
When is set to true and is it will be disposed when the context is disposed.

member.returns: Returns the original instance to allow for fluent API calls.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IDeviceContext.AddListener``1
member.summary: Registers a new device listener for that context.
member.remarks: Registered listeners can't be unsubscribed individually. All listeners will unsubscribed when the context is disposed.
member.returns: Returns the original instance to allow for fluent API calls.

member.name: T:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IDeviceReference
member.summary: A handle that can be used to open an instance.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IDeviceReference.DeviceName
member.summary: A user friendly display name.
member.remarks: The device name is not part of the equality for a device reference handle. This means, that there can be two s with different names which are still considered to be equal, because they refer to the same device.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IDeviceReference.Keys
member.summary: Gets the key layout for the referenced device.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IDeviceReference.Open
member.summary: Connects to a macro board and returns an instance which can be used to interact with the board.

member.name: T:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IKeyBitmapDataAccess
member.summary: An interface that allows you to access the underlying data of s

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IKeyBitmapDataAccess.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the underlying byte array is null.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IKeyBitmapDataAccess.GetData
member.summary: Gets the underlying image data in unaligned Bgr24 format (stride = width * 3).

member.name: T:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IKeyBitmapFactory
member.summary: Interface for factory extensions
member.remarks: This interface is intentionally empty It is used to implement factory extensions

member.name: T:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IKeyLayout
member.summary: Describes the key layout of an .

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IKeyLayout.KeySize
member.summary: Gets the image size of the keys that are supported.
member.remarks: In the rare case that the underlying board doesn't have square keys the value will be the size that most keys use, an average or a guess. If you need more accurate sizes you have the enumerate the key rectangles of this collection.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IKeyLayout.Area
member.summary: Gets the smallest rectangle area that fits all keys.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IKeyLayout.CountX
member.summary: Gets the number of keys in the horizontal direction.
member.remarks: In the rare case that the underlying board doesn't have a rectangular key layout this value might be an estimate or even wrong. It's not even guaranteed that times will be equal to Count but all implementations should make sure that the product is at least not greater than Count and is at least 1.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IKeyLayout.CountY
member.summary: Gets the number of keys in the vertical direction.
member.remarks: In the rare case that the underlying board doesn't have a rectangular key layout this value might be an estimate or even wrong. It's not even guaranteed that times will be equal to Count but all implementations should make sure that the product is at least not greater than Count and is at least 1.

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IKeyLayout.GapSize
member.summary: Gets the gap between the keys.
member.remarks: In the rare case that the underlying board doesn't have a rectangular key layout this value might be an estimate, made up or wrong.

member.name: T:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IKnownDevice
member.summary: A managed by a with additional meta data (like the connected state).

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IKnownDevice.Connected
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the current connection state. True if the device is currently connected, false if the device is disconnected.

member.name: T:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IMacroBoard
member.summary: An interface that allows you to interact with (LCD) macro boards

member.name: E:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IMacroBoard.KeyStateChanged
member.summary: Is raised when a key is pressed

member.name: E:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IMacroBoard.ConnectionStateChanged
member.summary: Is raised when the MarcoBoard is being disconnected or connected

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IMacroBoard.Keys
member.summary: Informations about the keys and their position

member.name: P:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IMacroBoard.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the MarcoBoard is connected.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IMacroBoard.SetBrightness(System.Byte)
member.summary: Sets the brightness for this
member.param: Brightness in percent (0 - 100)

remarks.para: The brightness on the device is controlled with PWM (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pulse-width_modulation). This results in a non-linear correlation between set percentage and perceived brightness.
In a nutshell: changing from 10 - 30 results in a bigger change than 80 - 100 (barely visible change) This effect should be compensated outside this library

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IMacroBoard.SetKeyBitmap(System.Int32,OpenMacroBoard.SDK.KeyBitmap)
member.summary: Sets a background image for a given key
member.param: Specifies which key the image will be applied on
Bitmap. The key will be painted black if this value is null.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IMacroBoard.ShowLogo
member.summary: Shows the standby logo (full-screen)

member.summary: Gets the firmware version.
member.returns: Returns the firmware version or if the device doesn't have a firmware.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IMacroBoard.GetSerialNumber
member.summary: Gets the serial number.
member.returns: Returns the serial number or if the device doesn't have a serial number.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.ImageSharpExtensions.WithBgr24(SixLabors.ImageSharp.Image)
member.summary: Creates a context with an .

remarks.para: If the image already is an this image will be wrapped inside the . If the image is a different pixel format it will be cloned and transformed into an .
Calling on the returned value will never dispose the original but only the implicitly cloned value if any.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.Internals.ConstrainedContext.For``2(``0,System.Func{``0,``1},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Creates a context which might depend on the provided item or a clone of that item.
member.remarks: This is useful in situation where you only want to do an expensive operation for types when needed. The makes sure that elements that depend on the parent (borrow, no copy) will not be disposed but cloned (owned copies) will be disposed.

member.name: M:OpenMacroBoard.SDK.MacroBoardFeatureExtensions.WithDisconnectReplay(OpenMacroBoard.SDK.IMacroBoard)
member.summary: Wraps an with a disconnect replay adapter.
member.param: The board that should be wrapped.
member.returns: Returns a new board that implements the replay feature.
member.remarks: This adapter makes sure, that if a device is disconnected that previously set properties like images and brightness are replayed if the device is connected again.
